extracted_text:
On August 27, 2025, Axis Bank clarified that recent technical changes to asset quality recognition norms were the cause of a spike in reported slippages during the first quarter of FY26 . Management stated that the new norms would have a minimal economic impact going forward.

Key details from the announcement:

In a Q1 FY26 earnings call, Axis Bank management explained that a technical, rather than fundamental, reclassification of certain retail accounts led to higher-than-usual reported slippages.

Despite this, the bank stated it is well-positioned for faster-than-industry growth from fiscal year 2026, supported by a strong balance sheet and stabilizing retail stress.

Management also noted that margins are expected to widen over the medium term.
